title: A  drifting  postbox for letters to people who died in the 2011 Japan Earthquake kept running
message:
May 20, 2024MORIOKA – A unique postbox that receives letters with messages for people who died in the 2011 Great East Japan Earthquake stands on the Hirota Peninsula in Rikuzen-Takata, Iwate Prefecture.
However, when he saw people who had lost their family members due to the Noto Peninsula Earthquake, he changed his mind.
Akagawa named the postbox “Drifting 3.11 Postbox” as it is the place where letters with nowhere to go would end up drifting.
Amid such circumstances, the situation in the areas hit by the Jan. 1 Noto Peninsula Earthquake reminded Akagawa of the situation immediately after the 2011 disaster.
“I am relieved that I could find a new custodian of the postbox,” Akagawa said.

title: 4 homes lost to wildfire near Fort Nelson , mayor says
message:
Evacuation orders remain in place around northern community, despite recent rain aiding effortsThe Mayor of British Columbia’s Northern Rockies Regional Municipality says four homes have been lost and six other properties have been damaged by a wildfire that forced the evacuation of Fort Nelson more than a week ago.
Rob Fraser says three of the four homes were occupied and one was vacant, but he’s been able to speak with most of the owners whose properties have been damaged.
Fraser says the affected properties were on the outskirts of Fort Nelson, and the six others saw damage to sheds, shops and vehicles.
Fire crews have also placed “structural protection measures” on 200 homes in Fort Nelson, and crews are being aided by both helicopters and heavy equipment, the update said.
mayor warns against videos of properties destroyed by fire near Fort NelsonThe Canadian Press

title: Power expected to be restored to most affected by deadly Houston storm
message:
HOUSTON — Houston area residents affected by deadly storms last week that left at least seven dead were finally getting some good news as officials said they expected power to be restored by Sunday evening to a majority of the hundreds of thousands still in the dark and without air conditioning amid hot and humid weather.
The widespread destruction of Thursday’s storms brought much of Houston to a standstill.
A tornado also touched down near the northwest Houston suburb of Cypress.
More than 352,000 homes and businesses in Texas remained without electricity Sunday morning, with most of those in the Houston area.
No hot water.

title: 127 MPH Winds Reported in Houston on Thursday
message:
One report from the Texas Storm Chasers recorded 127.5 MPH winds just west of Downtown Houston.
At one point, more than 1 million power outages were reported in Texas, most in the Houston area.
Large electricity towers have been destroyed and schools have been canceled for Friday throughout Houston.
According to weather.com, residents were warned to brace for extended power outages due to damage to 10 major power transmission lines.
On this year's prediction map, Houston and Galveston have red circles for direct landfalls.

title: Climate change impacts millions in India . But as the country votes , some politicians skirt the issue
message:
But there has been little talk about climate change on the campaign trail.
“Climate change is still not among the headlines during these elections despite its obvious impact on millions of Indian lives,” said Anjal Prakash, author of multiple United Nations climate reports.
Here's a look at how the effects of climate change are influencing voters.
But floods are now more devastating and unpredictable because of climate change, locals say, making it harder to stay on the islands.
Considered one of the world’s most vulnerable regions to climate change according to a 2021 report, Ali said the lack of political will is only making life harder.

title: Facing rising claims , insurer Intact is trying to protect homes before they burn
message:
Hours later, they were in the suburbs of Fort McMurray, Alta., to help fireproof hundreds of residential homes from a blaze that was closing in on the city.
Last year, Intact paid out more than $1-billion in natural-disaster claims, with a significant portion related to wildfires.
In Fort McMurray, the number of task forces may change depending on the condition of the fire.
“But we also needed to get to [Fort McMurray] before the fire would make a jump and start moving, and those jumps are in the afternoon.”When the team arrived in Fort McMurray early in the morning, the fire was about 19 kilometres away from town.
In Alberta, it is available to all residents who live south of the 57th parallel line, which begins at Fort McMurray.

title: Power restored to most affected by deadly Houston storm , with the rest by Wednesday
message:
By Sunday evening, 88% of customers in the Houston area had their power restored, said Paul Lock, a spokesperson for CenterPoint Energy.
More than 289,000 homes and businesses in Texas remained without electricity Sunday evening, mostly in the Houston area.
CenterPoint Energy said 2,000 employees and more than 5,000 contractors were working in the Houston area to restore power.
Carolina Sierra and her 6-year-old son, Derek, enjoyed the air conditioning for a couple of hours Sunday.
Two other large school districts in the Houston area – Cypress-Fairbanks and Spring Branch – planned to be closed.

title: Power expected to be restored to most affected by deadly Houston storm
message:
More than 352,000 homes and businesses in Texas remained without electricity Sunday morning, with most of those in the Houston area.
Carolina Sierra and her 6-year-old son, Derek, enjoyed the air conditioning for a couple of hours Sunday.
CenterPoint Energy said it anticipated that about 80% of affected customers in the Houston area would have service restored by Sunday evening.
CenterPoint Energy said 2,000 employees and more than 5,000 contractors were working in the Houston area to restore power.
The Houston Independent School District, the state’s largest, said power had been restored to nearly 200 campuses and those schools would be open Monday.

title: 5 Texas Towns People Are Fleeing As Soon As Possible
message:
Let’s delve deeper into five Texas towns currently experiencing population decline and explore the unique factors driving this trend.
Without essential services and economic opportunities, small towns like Valentine risk becoming ghost towns, losing their vibrant history and cultural heritage.
A Crossroads for Texas Towns: The Road AheadThe exodus from these five Texas towns paints a complex picture.
The Future of Small-Town AmericaThe exodus from small towns in Texas serves as a cautionary tale.
This blog post merely scratches the surface of the complex issues surrounding the exodus from small towns in Texas.

title: Rain , storms likely Sunday night and Tuesday
message:
Widespread rain and storms are likely.
There will be two rounds of widespread rain and storms, and both could bring locally heavy rain.
Scattered rain and storms are possible early Tuesday morning, then another widespread round of storms develops late in the day.
North and west of the severe weather, widespread heavy rain is likely.
From Sunday night through Tuesday night, rain totals of 1 to 2 inches are likely across most of the state.

title: Minnesota officials expect summer air quality to be again impacted by wildfires
message:
Gloomy skies, coupled with an air quality alert across parts of the state last weekend, have some people this weekend wondering if Mother Nature was giving a warning about the summer ahead.
This month, state officials are predicting another summer with poor air quality.
They say it’ll be worse than average, because of more wildfire smoke than average coming from Canada; but perhaps not as bad as last summer.
Last summer, the Minnesota Pollution Control Agency issued 21 air quality alerts spanning 52 days.
This summer the MPCA expects to issue more than seven air quality alerts.

title: Flood Damage A Growing Risk For NZ Kelp Forests
message:
Flood Damage A Growing Risk For NZ’s Kelp ForestsTimber slash and debris from flooding events is decimating Aotearoa New Zealand’s vital underwater kelp forests, a nationwide study shows.
“Sunlight, on which thriving kelp forests depend, is obstructed by this run-off in shallow coastal water.
Our research shows there’s a rapidly accelerating degradation of our iconic kelp forests and this is a major concern for marine biodiversity,” Professor Schiel says.
Kelp forests support many species of invertebrates, sponges and other plants that coastal fish species feed on.
We now need to find ways to improve coastal management and prevent run-off from land damaging kelp forests.

title: Earthquake Of 4 Magnitude Hits Ladakh
message:
Ladakh, May 20: An earthquake of magnitude 4.0 hit the Union Territory of Ladakh on Monday, according to National Centre for Seismology (NCS).
The epicentre of the earthquake was located at Latitude 35.93 N and Longitude 73.95 E, at a depth of 10 kilometres, the NCS stated.
“EQ of M: 4.0, On: 20/05/2024 05:49:01 IST, Lat: 35.93 N, Long: 73.95 E, Depth: 10 Km, Location: Ladakh,” NCS posted on X.

title: Bradford Council hits back at  diabolical  bus system comment | Bradford Telegraph and Argus
message:
New routes and bus stop locations were introduced on Sunday, April 14 as the city centre pedestrianisation took shape.
But the move caused confusion, with many bus users labelling the system an "absolute shambles".
A bus pulls up at the downhill stop on Vicar Lane, while the uphill stop and lane (on the left) remains closed (Image: Telegraph & Argus)Vicar Lane was at the epicentre of this and the uphill lane, including the bus stop there, is “closed until further notice”.
"Where possible, we will consider further enhancement to services within the resources we have available.”The works in Bradford city centre, as seen on Friday, May 17 (Image: T&A)A Bradford Council spokesperson said: “We understand people’s frustration at the disruption in the city centre.
"Once the works have been complete the city centre will be a much nicer and easier place for people to spend time.

title: Agency News | Earthquake of Magnitude 4 . 0 on Richter Scale Hits Ladakh
message: The epicentre of the earthquake was located at Latitude 35.93 N and Longitude 73.95 E, at a depth of 10 kilometres, the NCS stated.

title: Stormy start to the week
message:
This will be the end to our quiet weather, at least until the middle of this coming week.
A First Alert Day is called for Monday.
What’s Coming Up...Tuesday continues our First Alert Day as our next storm moves in.
We’re looking for a wet start to the day with showers possibly strong thunderstorms and heavy downpours.
Click here to download the NBC15 News app or our NBC15 First Alert weather app.

title: City of Mission prepares for hurricane season with cleanup project
message:
City of Mission prepares for hurricane season with cleanup projectLoads of tires, old mattresses and other unwanted items were dropped off in Mission on Saturday as the city prepared residents ahead of hurricane season.
The city held a community roundup event at 1400 S. Conway Ave. where residents were allowed to drop off bulky items and tires.
The city says preventing illegal dumping is important, especially in flood-prone areas.
A total of 500 tires were collected, and the city says they plan to hold more of these events in the coming months.

title: Flooding places bridges at risk
message:
THREE bridges connecting Wau-Waria and Bulolo are under threat of being washed away by heavy flooding in Wau, Morobe.
The abutments on the opposite ends of two of the bridges have been washed away by the floods and are standing in the middle of the river.
Pinetop Bridge connecting the two districts is under threat of being swept away by the flooding waters if the rain continues.
Part of the road between Four Road and Koranga Bridge was washed away and is also under threat of being washed away.
Bulolo DDA youth representative Yemon Bisa said hundreds of families have been displaced by the flooding and the DDA had supplied food, cooking utensils and shelter for the displaced families living near Bulolo river.

title: Probing Nigeria commitment to 2060 net zero emissions target
message:
Climate change is the biggest issue facing the world today.
It says fossil fuels – coal, oil and gas – are by far the largest contributor to global climate change, accounting for over 75 per cent of global greenhouse gas emissions and nearly 90 per cent of all carbon dioxide emissions.
Sixteen days later, it signed its Climate Change Bill into law, perhaps, to show the world that it was ready to keep the promise it made at the United Nations Climate Change Conference.
Can it also end deforestation by 2030 as part of measures to fight climate change as it pledged?
“Nigeria’s climate financing needs over 2020 to 2030 were estimated at $247.3 billion – an annual average of about $22.5 billion.

title: At least 66 people killed in flooding in northern Afghanistan
message:
Local authorities in Afghanistan say floods in the northern province of Faryab have killed at least 66 people.
The provincial authorities said the flooding on Saturday also washed away or damaged around 1,500 houses and left eight people missing.
Afghanistan has been hit by a series of flash floods due to heavy rains this month.
Providing assistance to those affected by the flooding, and restoring their livelihoods, are major challenges for Afghanistan.
The country is facing economic difficulties, as well as food shortages, under the rule of the Taliban which retook power three years ago.

title: NetNewsLedger - Update 2 : Alberta Wildfire Information Update : May 19 , 2024
message:
Re-entry for the Regional Municipality of Wood Buffalo continues.
Up-to-date information is available at alberta.ca/wildfire.
EDMONTON – Wildfire Update – There is an easing as the evacuation orders have been lifted.
Here is the latest information on the wildfire situation in Alberta.
